responses.text: [Danger Sense] *Determine if the voice is a threat*
[Danger Sense 8+] *Determine if the voice is a threat*

dynamic_line: &You extend your senses, alert for danger, and are immediately almost blinded.  In the heart of the portal storm, there's danger everywhere.  In the air and ground, in the things half-glimpsed that vanish when you look at them, and in yourself, just waiting for the right conditions to be unleashed.  If there's any additional danger in the voice's offer, you cannot tell.

&You extend your senses, alert for danger.  Shutting out the ever-present danger of the post-Cataclysmic world and the portal storm, you focus on the voice.  There is danger there, but not directly.  Whatever the outcome of its offer, it is not meant as a trap.

&You open your inner eye and in its light you see the truth.  This [is] you.  Was you.  Might be you.  You know it like you know yourself.  Whatever game it's playing, its intentions are not malicious. They are your own.

responses.text: What do I need to do?
[Gateway 8+] Thanks, but here I can leave without your help.  Be seeing you. (This will end your game.  Do not choose this option if you wish to continue playing.)

dynamic_line:
&Normally you need to have been to your destination to teleport to it, but here in this nexus of possibility you can sense other worlds.  Other times.  An endless torrent of possibility, flowing continuously around and over you.  None of them last long enough for you to get a good glimpse at them, but almost anywhere has to be better than here.  With an effort of will, you reach out and grasp one chance as it floats by, open a doorway, and leave the dying world behind.

And what happens to you afterwards, well, that's another story.

responses.text: That's what life's about: making the right choice at the right time.
